page.title: 22Wokingham Without: Pinewood Centre
page.content:
The Pinewood Centre is owned by Wokingham Borough Council and sublet to Wokingham Without Parish Council, which in turn sub lets various of the buildings and areas of land to a whole gamut of community clubs and societies. The Parish Office is located at the Centre and is open to the public between the hours of 10am - 12noon.

The Parish Council receives no financial support from the Borough Council (other than in the form of a low rent) and is fully responsible for maintaining and administering the site. The site is funded by the leasehold rental income and service charges generated by the sub leases, hourly rental fees from Pinewood Hall and supported by the parish precept i.e. the council tax paid by the 2,727 households in Wokingham Without.

The Borough Council states that it recognises the strategic importance of the Pinewood Centre in terms of the recreational, sporting and community facilities of the Borough but this does not translate into any tangible financial support.

Clubs & Societies at Pinewood Centre (2011)

Pinewood Football Club

Pinewood Allotment Association

Pinewood Shooting Association

East Berks Operatic Society

Pinewood Bar and Cafe

Pinewood Judo Club

Pinewood Gymnastics Club

Pinewood Miniature Railway Society Ltd

Bracknell Railway Society

Thames Valley Tug of War

2nd Crowthorne Scout Group

South East Berks Gang Show

Pinewood Motorcycle Training Unit

Jayne Coleman Academy of Dance

Pinewood Raceway

Starr Boxing Club

Flying Start Nursery

Wokingham & Crowthorne Table Tennis Club

Pinewood Short Mat Bowls

Yoga

British Red Cross Medical Loans

Other facilities on the site include:

Under-12 play area - limited range of equipment.

Glass and Textile Recycling Banks

Adventure Play area

Almost 18 acres of woodland including pond and dipping platform

Adult Trim Trail

Community Orchard


Wokingham Without Parish Council
